forecast-period.text: A high pressure system south of the Bight is moving slowly eastwards and will be positioned south of Tasmania by Tuesday. A trough of low pressure will move into the far west of the State on Tuesday.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-659-215* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.

A slight chance of showers about the southern agricultural area, and also in the far northwest of the State. Cool to mild, grading to warm near the northern border. Light to moderate south to southeasterly winds tending easterly in the far west. Moderate to fresh afternoon coastal sea breezes.

A slight chance of light morning showers about parts of southern coasts. A slight chance of showers west of about Ceduna to Ernabella/Pukatja, with a possible thunderstorm near the western border. Cool to mild about southern coasts grading to warm to hot in the far north and west. Mainly light to moderate southeast to northeasterly winds.

The medium chance of showers and thunderstorms west of about Ceduna to Ernabella/Pukatja, increasing to a high chance in the far northwest. The slight chance of showers extending over Eyre Peninsula. Mild in the south, warm in the north. Mainly light to moderate southeast to northeasterly winds.

text.p: The slight chance of showers and thunderstorms northwest of Coober Pedy, increasing to a high chance in the far northwest. The slight chance of showers over the remainder, west of a line Coober Pedy to Adelaide. Warm to hot. Light to moderate north to northeast winds, fresh in the west, turning southerly in the far west.
Cumulative rainfall totals to midnight Tuesday are expected to be below 2 mm, reaching 2 to 5 mm in the west. Local falls of 10 to 20 mm with thunderstorms, reaching 20 to 30 mm in the far northwest.

forecast-period.text: A slight chance of early showers over the agricultural area on Wednesday and possibly in the far northwest. A slight chance of showers in the far southwest on Thursday, extending over the agricultural area and west coast on Friday.
